title: State Transition error - Invalid attestation: Signature is invalid
body:
Seen this a handful of times in the logs, most recently today. If it's due to receiving an invalid block from a peer, then there's not much an operator can do about this, so it is probably better to move it to DEBUG level. But it might also be due to something internal that needs to be fixed.

```
2020-07-09 00:26:41.512+00:00 | ValidatorApiChannel-0 | INFO  | teku-validator-log | ^[[34mValidator   *** Published block        Count: 1, Slot: 68383, Root: 6017b1..5c80^[[0m
2020-07-09 00:26:41.614+00:00 | events-420 | WARN  | StateTransition | State Transition error
tech.pegasys.teku.core.exceptions.BlockProcessingException: tech.pegasys.teku.core.exceptions.BlockProcessingException: Invalid attestation: Signature is invalid
        at tech.pegasys.teku.core.StateTransition.initiate(StateTransition.java:88) [teku-ethereum-core-0.12.1-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.12.1-dev-3e9bc8a3]
        at tech.pegasys.teku.core.ForkChoiceUtil.on_block(ForkChoiceUtil.java:223) [teku-ethereum-core-0.12.1-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.12.1-dev-3e9bc8a3]
        at tech.pegasys.teku.statetransition.forkchoice.ForkChoice.onBlock(ForkChoice.java:77) [teku-ethereum-statetransition-0.12.1-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.12.1-dev-3e9bc8a3]

        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:567) ~[?:?]

        at com.google.common.eventbus.Subscriber$SynchronizedSubscriber.invokeSubscriberMethod(Subscriber.java:144) [guava-28.1-jre.jar:?]

        at tech.pegasys.teku.core.blockvalidator.SimpleBlockValidator.validatePreState(SimpleBlockValidator.java:78) ~[teku-ethereum-core-0.12.1-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.12.1-dev-3e9bc8a3]
        at tech.pegasys.teku.core.blockvalidator.BatchBlockValidator.validatePreState(BatchBlockValidator.java:43) ~[teku-ethereum-core-0.12.1-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.12.1-dev-3e9bc8a3]

        at tech.pegasys.teku.core.StateTransition.initiate(StateTransition.java:97) ~[teku-ethereum-core-0.12.1-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.12.1-dev-3e9bc8a3]

        at com.google.common.eventbus.Subscriber$SynchronizedSubscriber.invokeSubscriberMethod(Subscriber.java:144) [guava-28.1-jre.jar:?]
        at com.google.common.eventbus.Subscriber$1.run(Subscriber.java:72) [guava-28.1-jre.jar:?]
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1128) [?:?]
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:628) [?:?]
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:830) [?:?]
Caused by: tech.pegasys.teku.core.exceptions.BlockProcessingException: tech.pegasys.teku.core.exceptions.BlockProcessingException: Invalid attestation: Signature is invalid
        at tech.pegasys.teku.core.StateTransition.initiate(StateTransition.java:88) ~[teku-ethereum-core-0.12.1-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.12.1-dev-3e9bc8a3]
        ... 13 more
Caused by: tech.pegasys.teku.core.exceptions.BlockProcessingException: Invalid attestation: Signature is invalid
        at tech.pegasys.teku.core.BlockProcessorUtil.verify_attestations(BlockProcessorUtil.java:399) ~[teku-ethereum-core-0.12.1-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.12.1-dev-3e9bc8a3]
        at tech.pegasys.teku.core.blockvalidator.SimpleBlockValidator.validatePreState(SimpleBlockValidator.java:78) ~[teku-ethereum-core-0.12.1-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.12.1-dev-3e9bc8a3]

        at tech.pegasys.teku.core.StateTransition.initiate(StateTransition.java:85) ~[teku-ethereum-core-0.12.1-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.12.1-dev-3e9bc8a3]

```

```
teku/v0.12.1-dev-3e9bc8a3/linux-x86_64/-privatebuild-openjdk64bitservervm-java-13
```

Seems like we see this issue in the blocks we propose, and so we either don't verify some attestations we get over the wire correctly or create an invalid attestation as we did in the past. This actually looks eerily similar to: https://github.com/PegaSysEng/teku/issues/2179
Keeping this active for a little longer but haven't seen this issue in a while so it might have been fixed.

Reopening - sorry!

@protolambda is seeing this or something very like it today. [Logs](https://gist.github.com/protolambda/fac25701d257769fe9eb8449e4d0bc0e)

This is on the **Teku attacknet**, running develop docker image, `teku-ethereum-core-0.12.2-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.12.2-dev-836fbd4f`

Note that this network was actively under attack during this period by @jrhea. I believe he will be writing up the attack which may help with further investigation.
